page.title: 14HIGHER BILLINGE LANE FARM
page.content: This is a dairy farm, it is worked by John Birchall, it has been in his family for many years,but the Tatlock herd was started by his father, it was named after a hillock on their land. It was originally an arable farm but after opencast mining had taken out the minerals the land was only fit for grazing. The herd is of freisian heffers, they have no bulls, they rely on artificial insemination to produce stock to carry on the herd. At the moment there are about 80 head of cattle which have to be milked twice daily, at 6.30 a.m. and 4.30p.m. The milk is stored in large cool tanks until the tanker calls to pick it up at about 12 noon. The milk is then taken to Unigate Dairies in Liverpool for treatment and bottling, before being sent out to the customers.
